answers.author: Warren Meyer
answers.text:
We operate parks for the USFS around the country.  In the Sedona area, as well in Florida, we offer 3 and 7 day passes.  The passes are sequentially number hang tags in five colors that rotate by week.  There is a large box on the front where we fill in the expiration date as well as he license plate of the car.  This way either at the gate house or on compliance checks in the park we can quickly see if the pass is valid and that it is being used in the car in which it was assigned (which is part of our rules).  The hangtags are just cardstock - the annual passes work the same way but use plastic.
Contact me if you need to know more
Warren Meyer
Recreation Resource Management
warren@camprrm.com

author: Pamela Muse
text:
Sonoma County, CA is developing a three-day pass for parks, targeted to tourists/visitors to Sonoma County who want more than a one-day experience but don’t want to buy an annual pass. We are interested in learning about any other organizations which have short-term, time-limited passes such as these so that we can find out how the produce and monitor the passes.  
I’d appreciate either information on their methods, or a contact person, or both. 
Don Schwartz
707-565-3777
DSCHWART@sonoma-county.org
title: 3-Day Pass for Parks - Tourism/Visitors
